https://github.com/gundalow/ansible/blob/docs-argspec/docs/docsite/rst/dev_guide/developing_modules_general.rst#main-and-ansiblemodule-argument-spec

Maybe `required_if` would do the same thing?

`required_if` seems like the wrong way to go about this, as it isn't an error, it's just a notice that if one has specified password, they probably have the wrong key (unless they have also specified configured_password)

^ Precisely. I know that people are going to use "password" as the arg for the user's password because that's the intuitive thing to do, so I want to try to warn them when they make that mistake. Setting "password" and not "configured_password" is still valid, so we can't raise an exception in that scenario.
